title: Multimodal Instructional Method Development for Facilitating Aphasia Community Groups (CAGs)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in speech-language pathology, group therapy experience, and LMS platform proficiency
context.additional_context: An integrated online course combining theory and practice to improve CAG facilitation skills for medical professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core principles of CAG facilitation (communication support, engagement promotion, conflict management) with 85% or higher accuracy
Learners are assessed on their ability to design CAG sessions using multimodal materials (text, video, simulation)
Learners develop three facilitation scenarios based on peer feedback in online discussion forums
Learners achieve a score of 4.0/5.0 or above on the CAG facilitation skills checklist in the final evaluation
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
